info.name: Login System API
info.description:
Postman Collection v2.1 for the Login System REST API.

All auth endpoints live under the Auth folder.

Workflow:
1. Call **Register** or **Login** to obtain tokens.
2. Copy `accessToken` from the response into the `accessToken` collection variable.
3. Copy `refreshToken` into the `refreshToken` collection variable.
4. Use **Set Password** (Authorization header is pre-filled via `{{accessToken}}`). Only valid for OAuth users where `passwordSet=false`.
5. When the access token expires, call **Refresh Token** to rotate both tokens.
6. Call **Logout** to revoke the refresh token and end the session.

request.description:
Create a new local user account.

Required fields: `name`, `email`, `password` (12â€“72 characters).
Optional fields: `phoneCountryCode`, `phoneNumber`, `addressLine1`, `city`, `state`, `zipCode`, `country`.

Returns 201 Created with an AuthResponse on success.
Returns 409 if the email is already registered.
Returns 400 if validation fails.

request.description:
Exchange a valid refresh token for a new JWT access token and refresh token (token rotation).

Set the `refreshToken` collection variable before calling this request.

Returns 200 with a new AuthResponse on success.
Returns 401 if the token is invalid or expired.

header.description: JWT access token obtained from login, register, or oauth2/token.

request.description:
Set or update the authenticated user's local password. Typically used after a Google OAuth2 login when `requiresPasswordSet` is `true`.

Requires a valid JWT Bearer token in the Authorization header. Set the `accessToken` collection variable after login.

Returns 200 with an updated AuthResponse on success.
Returns 400 if passwords do not match.
Returns 401 if the Bearer token is missing or invalid.

request.description:
Exchange a one-time opaque code (issued by the backend after a successful Google OAuth2 redirect) for a JWT access token and refresh token.

The code is short-lived (30s) and single-use. If `requiresPasswordSet` is `true` in the response, the user has not yet set a local password and should be directed to the set-password screen.

Returns 200 with an AuthResponse on success.
Returns 400 if the code is invalid, already consumed, or expired.

header.description: JWT access token for the authenticated user.

request.description:
Revokes all refresh tokens for the authenticated user, ending the session.

The JWT access token remains valid until its natural expiry (up to 1 hour). After logout, any attempt to use the revoked refresh token will return 401.

Returns 204 No Content on success.
Returns 401 if the Bearer token is missing or invalid.
